etymologies: Old English hæsel, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hazelaar ‘hazel tree’, hazelnoot ‘hazelnut’, and German Hasel, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin corylus

definitions: a temperate shrub or small tree with broad leaves, bearing prominent male catkins in spring and round hard-shelled edible nuts in autumn.

notes.text: Genus Corylus, family Betulaceae: several species, in particular the common Eurasian hazel (C. avellana), formerly widely managed as coppice

shortDefinitions: shrub or small tree bearing male catkins in spring and round edible nuts in autumn

definitions: a reddish-brown or greenish-brown color, especially of a person's eyes

examples.text: the laughing hazel eyes were serious now
